title: California Freedom of Information Act. Request: California Freedom of Information Act. Request: Pepsi and Coke (University of California - Santa Barbara)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: California Freedom of Information Act. Request: California Freedom of Information Act. Request: Pepsi and Coke (University of California - Santa Barbara)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the { California Freedom of Information Act. }, I hereby request the following records:

- A copy of any and all contracts (including associated amendments and exhibits) awarded to Pepsi, Coca-Cola, or any subdivision thereof, for the provision of beverages or other goods in any facilities under the purview of this organization, including all activities and buildings associated with athletics, sports, dining services, or otherwise. If this agency does not have a contract with either of the named companies, please provide the equivalent agreement with the currently employed company.
- If the contract(s) was cancelled, any and all materials related to its cancellation.
- If the contract was cancelled, the statement from the university about cancellation.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within { 5 days }.

Sincerely,

{ Kayla Henson }

communications.subject: Public Records Request :: R001263-012323
communications.communication:
Dear Kayla Henson: 
Thank you for your interest in public records of University of Nevada, Las Vegas. Your request was received in this office on 1/23/2023 and given the reference number R001263-012323 for tracking purposes. You requested the following: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the { Nevada Freedom of Information Act. }, I hereby request the following records:

- A copy of any and all contracts (including associated amendments and exhibits) awarded to Pepsi, Coca-Cola, or any subdivision thereof, for the provision of beverages or other goods in any facilities under the purview of this organization, including all activities and buildings associated with athletics, sports, dining services, or otherwise. If this agency does not have a contract with either of the named companies, please provide the equivalent agreement with the currently employed company.
- If the contract(s) was cancelled, any and all materials related to its cancellation.
- If the contract was cancelled, the statement from the university about cancellation.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within { 5 days }.

Sincerely,

{ Kayla Henson }

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Funiversity-of-nevada-las-vegas-5507%252Fnevada-freedom-of-information-act-request-nevada-freedom-of-information-act-request-pepsi-and-coke-university-of-nevada-las-vegas-139237%252F%253Femail%253Dpublicrecords%252540unlv.edu&url_auth_token=AAAvj_4QBv6zHnXm8DZIi7UBBcM%3A1pK9KL%3AoO_BPqY_0PIfPUm1Dt-9-1924I6fnK_N0VFIlt-MqY8 
 
Your request is being processed in accordance with the Nevada Public Records Act (NRS 239) and the NSHE Board of Regents Handbook and Policies. Pursuant to NRS 239.0107(1)(c) within 5 business days of receiving this request for public record the UNLV Office of Public Affairs will provide records for inspection or copying or notify the requester one of the following: 
 
 
  *  The University office does not possess the information and provide the name and address of the entity that does if known, or 
  *  The information cannot be available within five (5) business days and provide a date and time after which the record will be available to inspect or to obtain a copy, or The request is denied. 
Records are not always readily available. Due to the volume of requests, records accessibility, staff availability and legal constraints extra time may be needed to locate and produce some records. Your request will be forwarded to the appropriate department(s) to locate the records you seek. PLEASE NOTE: Nevada Administrative Code (NAC 239.867) provides no requirement for state agencies to create a public record that does not exist. Requests for information, legal research or answers to general questions are not subject to the requirements of the Nevada Public Records Act and will be handled accordingly. 
 
You can monitor the progress of your request in " My Request Center" 
Sincerely, 
 
UNLV Office of Public Affairs

title: TDCJ Correctional Officers (2019-2022)

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: TDCJ Correctional Officers (2019-2022)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Monthly electronic listings of all correctional officers employed in the Texas Department of Criminal Justice from January 1, 2019 to the present.

For each month, I’m seeking a spreadsheet, database, or delimited text file(s) — not paper records or a PDF created from data — with the following fields for each employee: full legal name, unique employee ID, race, gender, title, unit, full-time/part-time status, hire date, termination date, and gross annual salary. If you cannot produce any of these fields, please let me know and generate only the available variables.

If these data are not available at monthly intervals, please produce the datasets at the most frequent interval possible. For example, if the data is not available monthly, please produce the data at quarterly intervals.

In addition, please include any lookup tables that may be needed to interpret the data. For example, if departments are listed with codes linked to a separate table, I will be happy to join the records myself, rather than require your staff to do so.

I am comfortable working with large data sets and can receive the records in a variety of formats (.dbf, .csv, .mdb, etc).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ben Goehring

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request #1483-10-2022
communications.communication:
Mr. Goehring,

I will address both of your follow up questions in this email.


  1.  What is the definition of the LAST EMPL DATE variable?
     *   The most recent employment date for employees that have multiple employment dates.



  1.  Could you please also include a crosswalk of the various single letter race value in the data (e.g., B, W, I, P) to their full names?
     *   The letter represents the ethnic origin as present on their applications for employment.

                                                              i.      W-White

                                                            ii.      B-Black

                                                         iii.      H-Hispanic

                                                         iv.      A-Asian

                                                            v.      I-American Indian or Alaskan Native

                                                         vi.      P-Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

                                                       vii.      M-Two or More races

Please note that if you have any other questions, you will need to submit a new public information request.

Thank you,

Office of the General Counsel-TDCJ

title: Virginia State Open Records Law - Request

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Virginia State Open Records Law - Request
communications.communication:
Dear Sir / Madam, 

Would it be possible for you to send me a copy of any records that would show some or all of the following information:

1.	A list of ALL types of alternative asset investments, including private equity, venture capital, distressed debt, mezzanine, fund of funds, infrastructure, natural resources, real estate and private debt partnerships in which City of Alexandria Post-Employment Benefit Trust is an investor; and
2.	For each partnership, may I please have a copy of any alternative assets investment records that would show some or all of the following information:

a.	City of Alexandria Post-Employment Benefit Trust's total commitment to the partnership,
b.	the total contributions made by City of Alexandria Post-Employment Benefit Trust to the partnership to date,
c.	the total distributions received by City of Alexandria Post-Employment Benefit Trust from the partnership to date,
d.	the estimated current value of City of Alexandria Post-Employment Benefit Trust's holding in the partnership, and
e.	any available estimates of the Net and Gross IRR earned by City of Alexandria Post-Employment Benefit Trust to date on its investment in the partnership.

3.	In addition to this could you please provide me with an up to date account of your current asset allocations in the above asset classes including any direct investments you may have.

Thank you very much for your attention to this request. In the event that City of Alexandria Post-Employment Benefit Trust has no such investments, a simple note to this effect will suffice.  We understand that we may be charged for the cost of the copies requested, and agree to pay these charges. 

Thank you again for your attention to this request. 

Yours faithfully,

title: Missouri Freedom of Information Act. Request: Missouri Freedom of Information Act. Request: Pepsi and Coke (Missouri State University)

communications.subject: The Missouri Sunshine Law Request: Missouri Freedom of Information Act. Request: Missouri Freedom of Information Act. Request: Pepsi and Coke (Missouri State University)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the { Missouri Freedom of Information Act. }, I hereby request the following records:

- A copy of any and all contracts (including associated amendments and exhibits) awarded to Pepsi, Coca-Cola, or any subdivision thereof, for the provision of beverages or other goods in any facilities under the purview of this organization, including all activities and buildings associated with athletics, sports, dining services, or otherwise. If this agency does not have a contract with either of the named companies, please provide the equivalent agreement with the currently employed company.
- If the contract(s) was cancelled, any and all materials related to its cancellation.
- If the contract was cancelled, the statement from the university about cancellation.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within { 5 days }.

Sincerely,

{ Kayla Henson }

title: MDE Child Care Stabilization Grants Data

communications.subject: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: MDE Child Care Stabilization Grants Data
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Michigan Freedom of Information Act § 15.231 et seq., we request the following records:

All raw data collected by the Early Childhood Investment Corporation, as a contractor for the Michigan Department of Education, as a part of the fall, third-round award process for Michigan Department of Education's Child Care Stabilization Grants. Please include the most recent facility-level data, including, but not limited to:

    - Facility Name or LARA License Number;

    - Full-time staff employed at the facility;

    - Part-time staff employed at the facility;

    - Enrollment;

    - Available slots, or any information provided within the grant application relevant to the calculation of available slots at a given center.

This request is not being made for commercial purposes. In the event that there are fees, we would appreciate if you would inform us of the total charges in advance of fulfilling our request. We would prefer the request filled electronically, by email attachment.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Derek Kravitz

Investigations Editor, MuckRock

Direct: (573) 239-7440 

Email: derek@muckrock.com

muckrock.com

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

All reports, video recordings, audio records, lab results, evidence looks, search warrant applications and returns, 911 calls and CAD reports and any other documents possessed by your agency related to the murder of Randy Gori on Jan . 4, 2020.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Beth Hundsdorfer

communications.communication:
Dear Beth Hundsdorfer: 
Thank you for your interest in public records of Madison County, IL. Your request has been received and is being processed in accordance with Illinois Freedom of Information Act, 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq.. Your request was received in this office on 1/18/2023 and given the reference number S000550-011823 for tracking purposes. Records Requested: All reports, video recordings, audio records, lab results, evidence looks, search warrant applications and returns, 911 calls and CAD reports and any other documents possessed by your agency related to the murder of Randy Gori on Jan . 4, 2020.
The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 
Your request will be forwarded to the relevant department(s) to locate the information you seek and to determine the volume and any costs associated with satisfying your request. You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records in question. PLEASE NOTE: The Illinois Freedom of Information Act, 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq. does not require a governmental body to create new information, to do legal research, or to answer questions. 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the Public Records Center. 
Madison County, IL

communications.subject: Sheriff's Office Public Records :: S000550-011823
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

 RE: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST of January 18, 2023, Reference # S000550-011823. Dear Beth Hundsdorfer, The Madison County, IL received a public information request from you on January 18, 2023. Your request mentioned: “All reports, video recordings, audio records, lab results, evidence looks, search warrant applications and returns, 911 calls and CAD reports and any other documents possessed by your agency related to the murder of Randy Gori on Jan . 4, 2020. 
The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 
In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.” The amount of information requested is "unduly burdensome" for the public body. Before declining to comply with a request as unduly burdensome, the public body must extend to the requester an opportunity to reduce the request to manageable proportions. If a public body determines that the burden on the public body outweighs the public interest in obtaining the information, and that there is no way to narrow the request, it must notify the requester in writing, specifying the reasons why it would be unduly burdensome and the extent to which compliance would so burden the operations of the public body. Such a response is treated as a denial of the FOIA request. See 5 ILCS 140/3(g).  As such the Madison County Sheriff's Office is attempting to determine the extent and information that is present in the case and being requested.  Under section 3(e) of FOIA provides that the period for response may be extended by the public body The time for response may be extended if: (ii) the request requires the collection of a substantial number of specified records; The Madison County, IL has reviewed its files and has located responsive records to your request.  Your request is granted in part and denied in part.  These files were found to be redacted and released with the following exemptions: 7(1)(a) – In that the request relates to records prohibited from release by Federal or State law (i.e. Juvenile Arrest Records) 7(1)(b) – Private Information such as SSN, Phone Number(s), Addresses, DL numbers are protected from release 7(1)(c) – Releasing the records constitutes an unreasonable Invasion of Personal Privacy of those involved. DOB’s and family matters in which personal privacy outweighs the public interest are exempt. "personal information contained within public records, the disclosure of which would constitute a clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy."  Section 7(1)(c) defines an "[u]nwarranted invasion of personal privacy" as "the disclosure of information that is highly personal or objectionable to a reasonable person and in which the subject's right to privacy outweighs any legitimate public interest in obtaining the information." 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(c) (West 2018) In determining whether or not the disclosure of personal information would constitute a clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy, the public’s interest in disclosure must be balanced against the degree of invasion of privacy. FOIA contemplates a case-by-case analysis that is necessarily based upon the specific facts underlying a request for disclosure. A few examples of the types of information that have been approved by the Public Access Counselor for redaction under 7(1) (c) include: dates of birth; names and identifying information of victims in police reports; and graphic photos of the deceased’s body in an autopsy report. FOIA exempts from disclosure personal information contained in public records if disclosing that information would constitute a clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy for the person or persons to whom the information pertains. "Personal information" has been defined by the courts as information "that is private and confidential." Chicago Tribune v. Board of Education of the City of Chicago, 332 Ill. App. 3d 60 (1st Dist. 2002). The reports and information will be released upon completion and approval of the attorneys. Sheriff's Office Public Records - S000550-011823 Should you wish to file a request for review in regard to the redacted portion of your request, you can do so with the Public Access Counselor (“PAC”) at the Office of the Illinois Attorney General. 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a). Public Access Counselor 
Office of the Attorney General 
500 South 2nd Street 
Springfield, Illinois 62706 
Fax: 217-782-1396 
E-mail: publicaccess@atg.state.il.us If you choose to file a Request for Review with the PAC, you must do so within 60 calendar days of the date of this denial letter. 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a). Please note that you must include a copy of your original FOIA request and this denial letter when filing a Request for Review with the PAC. If you have any questions, or wish to discuss this further, please contact me. Sincerely, Detective Captain Brian Koberna Chief of Investigations Madison County Sheriff's Office, Illinois Illinois Chief Deputy Commander, Major Case Squad of Greater St. Louis 405 Randle Street Edwardsville IL 62025 Desk 618.296.4822 Fax 618.296.7080 
To monitor the progress or update this request please log into the Public Records Center (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=6HtRfOYLt5fXvpttM-2FU1HZzWSccqPWMaVzcVm7gYsFZOA9driweNhWXacvtyYW5c2hbWPPVpbxBPjGleTcjHDTDaEoONkjOt2mO2ImDfnla1Kl4F56t2dWxqMcT-2B-2BARKMMIx_3bq54wMFImlR8UefIX1AO864KhCP51J9exwzogLSQFFljO2cFrfF9e4O67pmgmR2ga1NELpE5OEYY3IZvg9eI21ZHnKP8bT7c-2BUGwGakFpe7HNm47L9fDsx3FJKtn5-2BBKhFxfIOp6XVwi8RzLuq8p9zBaK940hVMXGBM7PYaFzgq-2Fb65LC05gyugbc-2FUVPy29vBqE-2FuPThncGKbdSX41pmkFt0pCAyMzhQD-2BXYH7BtfBJyn-2Bjfez-2FBvL-2BJijdzR-2BTU-2B-2FNuojbahDyG0LlhEk8gE5cdkWCELkBiqkN1Z0z7lkFfqNi9j5C1TKAWO2wc5nTpWTpZ9IIV7AVgX-2FYRU5RhuiWzfCyk7RGVOPkGbMZrapEG68G-2BKoyucQoF40fUc1YjAppwXUxRMUor3Jh6fklw-3D-3D)

RE: Sheriff's Office Public Records created on January 18, 2023, Reference # S000550-011823 
 
Dear Beth, 
 
The Madison County, IL received a public records request from you on January 18, 2023. You requested the following: 
 "All reports, video recordings, audio records, lab results, evidence looks, search warrant applications and returns, 911 calls and CAD reports and any other documents possessed by your agency related to the murder of Randy Gori on Jan . 4, 2020. 
The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

Charges may apply for copies of responsive records. If there is a charge, I will provide an invoice that is due upon receipt. 
 
Thank you for your patience in awaiting this information. 
 
Sincerely, 
 
Brian Koberna

618-296-4822

If a public body determines that the burden on the public body outweighs the public interest in obtaining the information, and that there is no way to narrow the request, it must notify the requester in writing, specifying the reasons why it would be unduly burdensome and the extent to which compliance would so burden the operations of the public body. Such a response is treated as a denial of the FOIA request. See 5 ILCS 140/3(g).  As such the Madison County Sheriff's Office is attempting to determine the extent and information that is present in the case and being requested.  Under section 3(e) of FOIA provides that the period for response may be extended by the public body The time for response may be extended if: (ii) the request requires the collection of a substantial number of specified records; The Madison County, IL has reviewed its files and has located responsive records to your request.  Your request is granted in part and denied in part.  These files were found to be redacted and released with the following exemptions: 7(1)(a) – In that the request relates to records prohibited from release by Federal or State law (i.e. Juvenile Arrest Records) 7(1)(b) – Private Information such as SSN, Phone Number(s), Addresses, DL numbers are protected from release 7(1)(c) – Releasing the records constitutes an unreasonable Invasion of Personal Privacy of those involved. DOB’s and family matters in which personal privacy outweighs the public interest are exempt. "personal information contained within public records, the disclosure of which would constitute a clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy."  Section 7(1)(c) defines an "[u]nwarranted invasion of personal privacy" as "the disclosure of information that is highly personal or objectionable to a reasonable person and in which the subject's right to privacy outweighs any legitimate public interest in obtaining the information." 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(c) (West 2018) In determining whether or not the disclosure of personal information would constitute a clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy, the public’s interest in disclosure must be balanced against the degree of invasion of privacy. FOIA contemplates a case-by-case analysis that is necessarily based upon the specific facts underlying a request for disclosure. A few examples of the types of information that have been approved by the Public Access Counselor for redaction under 7(1) (c) include: dates of birth; names and identifying information of victims in police reports; and graphic photos of the deceased’s body in an autopsy report. FOIA exempts from disclosure personal information contained in public records if disclosing that information would constitute a clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy for the person or persons to whom the information pertains. "Personal information" has been defined by the courts as information "that is private and confidential." Chicago Tribune v. Board of Education of the City of Chicago, 332 Ill. App. 3d 60 (1st Dist. 2002). The reports and information will be released upon completion and approval of the attorneys. Sheriff's Office Public Records - S000550-011823 Should you wish to file a request for review in regard to the redacted portion of your request, you can do so with the Public Access Counselor (“PAC”) at the Office of the Illinois Attorney General. 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a). Public Access Counselor 
Office of the Attorney General 
500 South 2nd Street 
Springfield, Illinois 62706 
Fax: 217-782-1396 
E-mail: publicaccess@atg.state.il.us If you choose to file a Request for Review with the PAC, you must do so within 60 calendar days of the date of this denial letter. 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a). Please note that you must include a copy of your original FOIA request and this denial letter when filing a Request for Review with the PAC. If you have any questions, or wish to discuss this further, please contact me. Sincerely, Detective Captain Brian Koberna Chief of Investigations Madison County Sheriff's Office, Illinois Illinois Chief Deputy Commander, Major Case Squad of Greater St. Louis 405 Randle Street Edwardsville IL 62025 Desk 618.296.4822 Fax 618.296.7080 
To monitor the progress or update this request please log into the Public Records Center (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=6HtRfOYLt5fXvpttM-2FU1HZzWSccqPWMaVzcVm7gYsFZOA9driweNhWXacvtyYW5c2hbWPPVpbxBPjGleTcjHDTDaEoONkjOt2mO2ImDfnla1Kl4F56t2dWxqMcT-2B-2BARKgKIT_3bq54wMFImlR8UefIX1AO864KhCP51J9exwzogLSQFFljO2cFrfF9e4O67pmgmR2ga1NELpE5OEYY3IZvg9eIzDLsTZgthqN-2BUgoEeWPsXRPZx-2FTXzN6VlBpVWEhkTjoyZZimbc8AxIL1aIIAYj4hpmDSB7nqwReqZq-2F0X-2FOw-2BHlTvXrb-2F7QgrGftop6wTg9nUj9waORBOF5cDQr-2BeR1pMLH9iKm6-2FF3R-2Fy3Kb6QToZE-2Fy-2BqRVS17azDJtLGmSvrQGuZ-2BmI-2BCe8oInDcn-2FyJXEDa2Q8cTeWLrzWALj1uWIliE00AkqsErb6-2BFtc6e-2BAe3idagQ58aayLdlAb6CeX1DhA-2Bw9EWPdpY18tstAks4lVGgJ-2F-2Bmo84O4bUZg48zbZkGHAt0R-2FMmZ6TOhgxM9Q8Q-3D-3D)

communications.subject: RE: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request #S000550-011823
communications.communication: Please consider this a request for review. This request, one  identical to it, has been pending for more than a year. This request was made for the sole purpose of appeal after a very long period of no response to my inquiries for status.

communications.subject: RE: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request #S000550-011823
communications.communication:
Det. Koberna,

I sent an identical FOIA a year ago.  I have tried to get an update on the status of that request. I was told that it was being worked on and "don't call us, we will call you." Apparently, CBS News made a similar request and I assume that has not been fulfilled either. While I am quite sure that providing documents to the public is very important to your agency, more than a year to fulfill any portion of the request, which was pared down from the original, is unreasonable. 

This FOIA was submitted for the sole purpose of filing an appeal which I have done today.

Please feel free to call me if you have any questions, 

Beth Hundsdorfer
Reporter
Capitol News Illinois
(618)670-7502

title: Michigan Freedom of Information Act. Request: Michigan Freedom of Information Act. Request: Pepsi and Coke (Ferris State University)

communications.subject: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: Michigan Freedom of Information Act. Request: Michigan Freedom of Information Act. Request: Pepsi and Coke (Ferris State University)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the { Michigan Freedom of Information Act. }, I hereby request the following records:

- A copy of any and all contracts (including associated amendments and exhibits) awarded to Pepsi, Coca-Cola, or any subdivision thereof, for the provision of beverages or other goods in any facilities under the purview of this organization, including all activities and buildings associated with athletics, sports, dining services, or otherwise. If this agency does not have a contract with either of the named companies, please provide the equivalent agreement with the currently employed company.
- If the contract(s) was cancelled, any and all materials related to its cancellation.
- If the contract was cancelled, the statement from the university about cancellation.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within { 5 days }.

Sincerely,

{ Kayla Henson }

title: Danbury, CT legal expenses paid in connection with Sean Hearty

communications.subject: Connecticut Freedom of Information Act Request: Danbury, CT legal expenses paid in connection with Sean Hearty
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Connecticut Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Copies of all invoices paid by the City of Danbury for services provided by Sharon Wicks Dornfeld in connection with Board of Ethics complaint addressed at January 2020 Board of Ethics Meeting.

Copies of any correspondence between Ms. Dornfeld, the law firm she is affiliated with, and the City of Danbury in connection with said Ethics Complaint.

Documentation of any claims of exempt documents and reason for exemption.

I also request that, if possible and pursuant to Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-212(d), fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest and not made for commercial gain. The requested documents will be processed by a representative of the news media/press and made available to the public at MuckRock.com.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 4 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kevin Paige

communications.subject: Re: Connecticut Freedom of Information Act Request: Danbury, CT legal expenses paid in connection with Sean Hearty

anticipate approximately 30-45 days to comply with your request.  If any
responsive documents are available prior to that time, we will advise you.
Paper copies are billed at the statutory rate of $.50 per page, and costs
$10.00 or more are required to be pre-paid.

Sincerely,

Dianne Rosemark

-- 
Dianne Rosemark
Assistant Corporation Counsel
City of Danbury
203-797-4518

this information is prohibited. If you have received this message in error,
please notify the sender immediately.

communications.subject: City of Danbury FOI Request Fulfillment
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Paige
By way of introduction my name is Randall DiBella, I am an attorney that the City of Danbury sometimes engages to assist with FOI review and fulfillment due to the Corporation Counsel office's heavy FOI demands.  The City requested my assistance in reviewing the materials responsive to your request for Ethics Board records to determine disclosure and to deliver those that are not exempt to you electronically. I was provided what I am told is the entire pertinent file and have completed an exemption review.
I found that none of the records in the file is exempt from disclosure or in need of redaction. Accordingly I have attached in electronic format the entire Board of Ethics file that you requested.
Regards
D. Randall DiBella
Cramer & Anderson LLP
For the City of Danbury

title: Michigan State Employees (2016 - 2018)

communications.subject: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: Michigan State Employees (2016 - 2018)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Michigan Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Monthly electronic listings of all employees of the Michigan Executive Branch from January 1, 2016 to December 31, 2018. Specifically, I am seeking electronic listings of all non-exempt, classified individuals employed within all state agencies, commissions, and departments for each month from January 1, 2016 to December 31, 2018.

For each month, I’m seeking a spreadsheet, database, or delimited text file(s) — not paper records or a PDF created from data — with the following fields for each employee: full legal name, title, department or agency, full-time/part-time status, work zip code, original hire date, civil service status, and gross annual salary (i.e., the base hourly wage for each hourly employee and the base annual salary for salaried employees for each of the time periods in question). If you cannot produce any of these fields, please let me know and generate only the available variables.

If these data are not available at monthly intervals, please produce the datasets at the most frequent interval possible. For example, if the data is not available monthly, please produce the data at quarterly intervals.

In addition, please include any lookup tables that may be needed to interpret the data. For example, if departments are listed with codes linked to a separate table, I will be happy to join the records myself, rather than require your staff to do so.

I am comfortable working with large data sets and can receive the records in a variety of formats (.dbf, .csv, .mdb, etc).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ben Goehring

communications.subject: RE: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: Michigan State Employees (2016 - 2018)
communications.communication: Please see attached response to your FOIA request received on January 9. Thank you.

communications.subject: RE: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: Michigan State Employees (2016 - 2018)
communications.communication:
Thanks Kurt. I just paid using the online portal. 

Thank you for all of your assistance!

Ben

communications.subject: RE: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: Michigan State Employees (2016 - 2018)
communications.communication:
Requested, non-exempt records of full and part-time active executive branch classified employees for the time periods requested will be provided upon receipt of the balance due. Please see the attached response form for additional information, including applicable statutory exemptions from disclosure.

Thank you.

communications.subject: RE: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: Michigan State Employees (2016 - 2018)
communications.communication:
Please find attached your response to your FOIA request received on January 9.  Because the data files (excel spreadhsheets) are large, the responsive documents are being provided in 3 separate emails.  This is the first of three.

Thank you.

title: Records of Abandoned Mine Land emergencies and complaints

communications.subject: West Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Records of Abandoned Mine Land emergencies and complaints
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the West Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I would like to request a records of Abandoned Mine Lands complaints or emergencies sent to the West Virginia Department of Environmental Protection, between January 1st, 2021 and December 31st 2022. These records are sent to Jeremy Ayers at Jeremy.D.Ayers@wv.gov or (304) 842-1900, or Patrick Murphy at Patrick.M.Murphy@wv.gov or (304) 574-4465.

For more information on Abandoned Mine Land complaints or emergencies, please see: https://dep.wv.gov/dlr/aml/Pages/Report.aspx

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Grey Moran

communications.subject: Re: West Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Records of Abandoned Mine Land emergencies and complaints
communications.communication:
Hello:



This letter is to acknowledge that the West Virginia Department of
Environmental Protection’s (DEP) Public Information Office received your
Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) Request. Your request has been sent to
the appropriate office(s) within our agency and you will be notified as to
when you may review/copy/receive the requested information.



Information in agency files is available for public inspection.  However,
some material may be exempt from disclosure under the West Virginia Freedom
of Information Act, Chapter 29B.



DEP also provides an informational service to the public.  Visitors to the
agency’s website can subscribe to both a listing of permit actions open to
public comment and updates on DEP news and events.  To subscribe to these
e-mail notifications, go to
http://www.dep.wv.gov/insidedep/Pages/DEPMailingLists.aspx.  *Please submit
all FOIAs to **depfoia@wv.gov* <depfoia@wv.gov>*.  *



There is no charge to submit a FOIA request. If you need further
assistance, please contact me at 304-926-0499 ext. 49720.
Regards,



WVDEP - Public Information Office
